intro: Tephroseris atropurpurea subsp. frigida, commonly known as the purple tephroseris, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its biennial or perennial growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lobed and have a distinctive purplish hue, especially in cooler conditions. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous regions of the northern hemisphere.
